attempts.content:
Here is the Mermaid C4 Context diagram based on the provided project context:

```mermaid
graph LR
    A[User] -->|requests phone swap|> B[Phone Swap Request Feature]
    B -->|handles request|> C[Backend API Endpoint (POST /api/phone-swaps)]
    C -->|validates user ownership|> D[Database Table for Swap Requests]
    D -->|stores swap requests|> E[System Database]
    F[Product Manager] -->|creates Jira ticket|> G[Jira Ticket with User Story and Acceptance Criteria]
    H[UX Team] -->|creates wireframe|> I[Wireframe of Modal and Form]
    I -->|approved|> J[Frontend Team]
    J -->|builds modal structure|> K["Request Phone Swap" Button and Basic Modal Structure]
    L[Backend Team] -->|develops API endpoint|> M[New API Endpoint (POST /api/phone-swaps)]
    M -->|develops database schema|> N[Database Table for Swap Requests]
```

This C4 Context diagram illustrates the system boundaries and external actors involved in the Phone Swap Request Feature. The diagram shows how the user requests a phone swap, which triggers the backend API endpoint to handle the request. The API endpoint validates the user's ownership of the offered phone and stores the swap request in the database. The UX team creates a wireframe for the modal and form, while the frontend team builds the "Request Phone Swap" button and basic modal structure. The product manager creates a Jira ticket with the defined user story and acceptance criteria.

Note that this diagram is specific to this project and references entities, features, and requirements from the meeting notes and context provided.
